title: PART A: Identification
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Does not provide two accurate identifiers for the selected work of art
Response provides two accurate identifiers for the selected work of art

title: PART B: Thesis/Claim
stimulusHtml: To earn this point, the thesis must make an art historically defensible claim that responds to the prompt rather than merely restating or rephrasing the prompt. The thesis must consist of one or more sentences located in one place, either in the introduction or the conclusion.
descriptions: Does not respond to the prompt with an art historically defensible thesis or claim that establishes a line of reasoning
Responds to the prompt with an art historically defensible thesis or claim that establishes a line of reasoning

title: PART C: EVIDENCE - VISUAL AND CONTEXTUAL
stimulusHtml: To earn either point, the evidence provided must be accurate, relevant, and art historically defensible.
descriptions: Does not provide a specific example of visual OR contextual evidence relevant to the selected work of art and the topic of the prompt
Response provides one specific example of visual OR contextual evidence relevant to the selected work of art and the topic of the prompt
Response provides two specific examples of visual and/or contextual evidence relevant to the selected work of art and the topic of the prompt

title: PART D: ANALYSIS AND REASONING
stimulusHtml: To earn this point, the response must explain the relationship between the evidence provided and an argument about the prompt.
descriptions: Does not explain how the visual and/or contextual evidence provided supports the argument
Response explains how the visual and/or contextual evidence provided supports the argument

title: PART E: COMPLEXITY
stimulusHtml:
A response may demonstrate a complex understanding in a variety of ways, such as:

路 Explaining relevant and insightful connections between the evidence and the claim

路 Confirming the validity of a claim by corroborating multiple perspectives

路 Explaining the nuances of an issue by analyzing multiple variables

路 Qualifying or modifying a claim by considering diverse or alternative views or evidence

To earn this point, the complex understanding must be developed in the response and consist of more than a phrase or reference.
descriptions: Does not demonstrate a complex understanding of the prompt, using evidence to corroborate, qualify, or modify a claim that addresses the prompt

Response demonstrates a complex understanding of the prompt, using evidence to corroborate, qualify, or modify a claim that addresses the prompt

Examples of possible ways for students to earn this point include, but are not limited to, developing any of the following:
